item.title: Notes on Go
item.description: Repeating the same argument to Printf If we wanted to repeat the same argument to a call to fmt.Printf(), we can make use of “indexed” arguments. That is, instead of writing fmt.Printf("%s %s", "Hello", "Hello"), we can write fmt.Printf("%[1]s %[1]s", "Hello"). Learn about it in the docs. Multi-line strings Things are hassle free on the multi-line strings front: package main import ( "fmt" ) func main() { s := `Multi line strings are easy.
